topic: How to combine plistlib with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to combine plistlib with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)

response_parsed.title: Combining plistlib and Typing for Production-Ready Code in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer demonstrates the integration of plistlib and Type Hints to create robust, maintainable, and production-ready code in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Utilize Type Hints for enhanced type checking and improved readability
Leverage plistlib for handling property lists (plists) as natively supported by macOS and iOS
Create a reusable function with proper argument and return type annotations
version_notes: The code snippet is designed for Python 3.12+ and requires the plistlib module which comes pre-installed with macOS and can be installed via pip on other platforms.
caveats: Ensure to import NSObject from Apple's pythonobjc-core library when using Objective-C classes
Always check the plist structure for proper formatting before reading with plistlib
